item.title: grieving fennville rallies to win district title
item.description: fighting back tears, mitchell leonard walked to half court and accepted the class c district championship trophy.

item.title: manassero's malaysian victory books ticket to the majors
item.description: seventeen-year-old matteo manassero's malaysian open win has catapulted him from 57th to 33rd in the world rankings, earning him a place at this year's u.s. open, british open and u.s. pga championship.

item.title: the lede: april 4 updates on mideast protests and libyan war
item.description: on monday, the lede is following protest movements across the middle east and north africa and the war in libya.

item.title: ryan's stingy defense proves bo knows 'd' at wisconsin
item.description: wisconsin big man keaton nankivil sports a pretty nasty black left eye suffered last weekend en route to today's sweet 16 game against butler. ...

item.title: corrected: daycare owner pleads not guilty to manslaughter
item.description: (in final paragraph corrects location of tata's capture in nigeria)

item.title: marcia clark returns to court in first novel
item.description: the prosecutor from the o.j. simpson trial is out with 'guilty by association.'

item.title: in address to parliament, obama says u.s.-britain alliance is still vital
item.description: president obama told the parliament that britain and america were the 'greatest catalysts for global action.'

item.title: court affirms exclusive native american use of eagle feathers
item.description: the u.s. government is allowed to bar non-native americans from using eagle feathers for religious purposes, even for rituals that imitate or borrow from indian culture, a federal appeals court ruled on tuesday.

item.title: raid reveals bin laden eyed u.s. trains
item.description: some of the first information gleaned from osama bin laden's compound indicates al-qaeda considered attacking u.s. trains on the upcoming anniversary ...

item.title: aflac duck gets a minnesota accent
item.description: aflac is betting a tv advertising sales manager from minnesota has the voice to drive the name "aflac" into the recesses of your brain and keep ...

item.title: pregnant woman who ate rat poison charged with murder
item.description: an indianapolis woman who tried to commit suicide by eating rat poison near the end of her pregnancy was charged with murder in the death of her baby, officials said on wednesday.

item.title: returned to power, a leader celebrates a checkered past
item.description: desi bouterse, a former military ruler who has been convicted of drug trafficking and is still on trial for official killings in the 1980s, is once again suriname's leader.

item.title: bumgarner shuts down dodgers for first win
item.description: madison bumgarner came within an out of his first major league shutout and earned his first victory of the season, and freddy sanchez drove in ...

item.title: boston's murphy waits to help in 'exasperating' year
item.description: troy murphy's return home to new jersey originally excited him but subsequently resulted in frustration and outright exile from the nets. now he's playing in the eastern conference semifinals.

item.title: oregon suspends linebacker kiko alonso
item.description: oregon has indefinitely suspended linebacker kiko alonso following his arrest on burglary and trespassing charges.

item.title: sudan border strategy may bring in ethiopian peacekeepers
item.description: the contested status of an area straddling northern and southern sudan has become a worrisome issue as the country prepares to split into two.

item.title: singers from azerbaijan win eurovision contest
item.description: a singing duo was the surprise winner of the eurovision song contest on saturday, the first victory for the country in the contest.

item.title: hundreds feel sting of jellyfish on florida's east coast
item.description: thousands of jellyfish washed up on florida's east coast over the memorial holiday weekend, stinging swimmers and thwarting beachgoers.

item.title: libya declares sea blockade of rebel port
item.description: libya's government has threatened to attack any ships approaching the western rebel outpost of misrata, potentially depriving insurgents of a lifeline to the country's eastern insurgent heartland.

item.title: counting erasures at noyes
item.description: noyes education campus, a d.c. school, consistently has shown rates of erasures on standardized tests that were much higher than average rat ...

item.title: in this fairy tale, not one, but two queens in waiting
item.description: at britain's royal wedding of prince william and kate middleton, one of the most uneasy seats in the church may be the one occupied by camilla, duchess of cornwall.

item.title: air strike flattens building in gaddafi compound
item.description: nato forces flattened a building inside muammar gaddafi's bab al-aziziyah compound early on monday, in what his officials said was a failed attempt on the libyan leader's life.

item.title: deadlock in libya exposes international rifts
item.description: military deadlock in libya has exposed growing international rifts, with critics of nato bombing calling it another case of the west trying to overthrow a regime by stretching the terms of a u.n. resolution.

item.title: the lede: fireworks in yemen's 'change square'
item.description: as protesters celebrated the departure of yemen's president, who was evacuated to saudi arabi for medical treatment, fireworks filled the sky over the protest camp in the capital, sana.

item.title: nato strikes in misrata but shelling resumes
item.description: nato air strikes forced libyan government troops to withdraw from one of their positions in the besieged city of misrata overnight but they resumed bombardment of the port area using grad missiles, a rebel spokesman said.

item.title: libya angers tunisia as war briefly crosses border
item.description: libya's two-month civil war spilled over the border into tunisia, provoking outrage in the western neighbor, while rebels in misrata said only nato could halt the bombardment of the besieged city.

item.title: mortars pound misrata; west talks of tougher action
item.description: libyan government troops pounded the besieged rebel-held city of misrata overnight, undeterred by western threats to step up military action against muammar gaddafi's forces.

item.title: mccain visits rebels, libya adjusts misrata tactics
item.description: washington should deploy ground attack aircraft against muammar gaddafi's forces and recognize the rebels, leading senator john mccain said, becoming highest-profile western politician to visit rebel-held libya.

item.title: hotels offer ' and charge more for ' allergy-free rooms
item.description: hotels are setting aside ' and charging more for ' rooms for allergy sufferers. "hypoallergenic rooms" are cleaned to reduce dust mites, bacteria ...

item.title: government forces retreat in libya's misrata
item.description: government forces retreated in misrata but seized a rebel town in libya's remote western mountains, as no sign emerged of muammar gaddafi being dislodged from power despite more than a month of air strikes.

item.title: misrata comes under heavy bombardment: libya rebels
item.description: forces loyal to muammar gaddafi bombarded misrata on sunday, a day after rebels celebrated the pullback of government troops from the western libyan city, a rebel spokesman said.

item.title: phillies win 19-inning marathon with unlikely pitcher
item.description: the philadelphia phillies celebrated a 5-4 victory, in 19 innings, over the cincinnati reds that ended early on thursday after an unlikely pitching debut by second baseman wilson valdez.

item.title: rajaratnam convicted on all insider trading charges
item.description: hedge fund founder raj rajaratnam was found guilty on all 14 counts of insider trading in a sweeping victory for the government and a vindication of its aggressive use of phone taps to pursue wall street crimes.

item.title: libyan rebel leader in paris, conflict deadlocked
item.description: libyan rebel chief mustafa abdel jalil met french president nicolas sarkozy in paris on wednesday as western powers struggle to break a deadlock in the two-month conflict.

item.title: oman arrests six as protesters demand more jobs
item.description: omani police arrested six people involved in a demonstration monday demanding jobs and higher wages in the eastern town of jaalan bani bu ali, witnesses said, in another sign of the unrest sweeping the arab world.

item.title: judge cancels nfl mediation, says sides engaged in 'settlement' talks
item.description: the judge overseeing the mediation between the nfl and the nfl players association has cancelled next week's planned sessions because of what ...

item.title: yemen president to step down in month under deal
item.description: yemen's political opposition accepted a deal that would see president ali abdullah saleh step down in 30 days, bringing to an end the country's ...

item.title: talking tech | slacker introduces new music subscription program
item.description: new $9.99 monthly slacker subscription lets users listen on-demand.

item.title: new york public schools may bar after hours religion
item.description: an appeals court on thursday ruled that new york public schools could legally bar religious groups from using its facilities after hours for worship services.

item.title: rim announces new blackberry bold
item.description: the blackberry bold 9900 will have a touch screen and fresh software.

item.title: rajaratnam seeks to throw out guilty verdict
item.description: lawyers for hedge fund tycoon raj rajaratnam asked a judge on wednesday to throw out the galleon group founder's conviction on insider trading charges.

item.title: tokyo's nikkei share average closes down 6.18 percent
item.description: japan's benchmark nikkei average closed down 6.18 percent at 9,620.49 on monday, while the broader topix shed 7.49 percent to 846.96.

item.title: chrysler cuts plants' overtime for parts shortages
item.description: chrysler group llc became the latest automaker affected by the japan earthquake and its aftermath, as it said it would cancel overtime work at some of its north american assembly plants due to parts shortages.

item.title: couple threatens bank of america with foreclosure
item.description: months after bank of america wrongly foreclosed on a house warren and maureen nyerges had already paid for, they were still fighting to get reimbursed ...

item.title: libya's gaddafi survives air strikes, son killed
item.description: libyan leader muammar gaddafi survived a nato air strike on a tripoli house that killed his youngest son and three grandchildren, a government spokesman said on saturday.

item.title: theater review | 'the great divide': frontier woman's desperate proposition
item.description: 'the great divide,' an obscure 1906 melodrama written by william vaughn moody, provides clich??d characters who, at their best, are intriguing reflections of a changing nation.

item.title: "rio" rocks box office while "scream 4" bombs
item.description: moviegoers around the world headed to "rio" for the weekend.

item.title: slap that was heard across arab world "didn't happen"
item.description: hey called it the "slap heard around the arab world." and it never happened.

item.description: moviegoers around the world headed to "rio" for the weekend.

item.title: cas wants to combine wada, uci appeals of contador case
item.description: sport's highest court is to ask the world anti-doping agency and international cycling union to combine forces in their appeals against alberto ...

item.title: pro-am tribute raises almost $1 million for seve foundation
item.description: more than 600,000 pounds ($967,000) has been raised for the seve ballesteros foundation from the special wentworth tribute to the late spaniard, organizers said tuesday.

item.title: new guidelines define pre-alzheimer's disease
item.description: the first new guidelines for diagnosing alzheimer's disease in nearly 30 years establish earlier stages of the mind-robbing disease, paving the ...

item.title: e-book report: nook is up, ipad still catching up
item.description: kindle seen as clear leader, with nook a pleasant surprise.

item.title: protesters march in south syria for fifth day
item.description: hundreds of people marched in southern syria for a fifth straight day on tuesday, protesting against the government of president bashar al-assad and shouting "freedom, freedom. peaceful, peaceful."

item.title: gaddafi envoy in greece as turkey rescues wounded
item.description: the libyan government sent an envoy to greece on sunday to discuss an end to fighting, but gave no sign of any major climbdown in a war that has ground to a stalemate between rebels and forces loyal to muammar gaddafi.

item.title: analysis: nfl labor fight a long way from over despite ruling
item.description: it's not over yet. players scored a key victory and gained significant momentum with the 89-page ruling from judge susan richard nelson on monday ...

item.title: libya wounded describe siege hell, turkey seeks peace
item.description: forces loyal to libyan leader muammar gaddafi are staging a "massacre" in the besieged city of misrata, evacuees said on monday, as turkey said it was trying to broker a ceasefire to halt the bloodshed.

item.title: u.s. women's soccer team named for world cup
item.description: though it may seem the u.s. women's soccer team has dominated the sport the last two decades, in truth, the usa is looking to win its first women's ...

item.title: libyan rebels condemn nato over gaddafi advance
item.description: the head of libya's rebel army has condemned nato for its slow chain of command in ordering air strikes to protect civilians, saying the alliance was "letting the people of misrata die every day."

item.title: libya says nato air strike hits major oil field
item.description: libya said a u.n.-mandated british air strike had hit its major sarir oilfield killing three guards and damaging a pipeline connecting the field to a mediterranean port.

item.title: libyan rebels blame deadly strike on nato mistake
item.description: rebels fighting to overthrow muammar gaddafi said five of their fighters were killed when nato planes mistakenly bombed a rebel tank column near the contested port of brega in eastern libya.

item.title: rebels repel assault on misrata, five dead
item.description: libyan rebels said on friday they had repulsed a government assault on the besieged western port city of misrata and a resident said five people were killed in the fighting.

item.title: libya rebels repel attack on misrata, gaddafi appears
item.description: libyan rebels beat off a new assault by muammar gaddafi's forces on the besieged western city of misrata on saturday, losing eight of their fighters in fierce street battles, the insurgents said.

item.title: afghanistan, pakistan upgrade peace efforts
item.description: afghanistan and pakistan have upgraded a joint commission for peace in a bid to end afghanistan's near-decade old insurgency, and have the support of the u.s. for the move, leaders of the two countries said on saturday.

item.title: when children's scribbles hide a prison drug
item.description: a treatment for opiate addiction has become a favorite contraband among prisoners nationwide, and a constant test for prison officials.

item.title: environmental lobby urges eu limits on chemicals
item.description: environmental lobby chemsec on tuesday highlighted 22 hormone-disrupting chemicals routinely found in plastics, packaging and cosmetics that it wants regulated by the european union.

item.title: "idol" creator simon fuller gets hollywood star
item.description: simon fuller, the british creator of hit tv show "american idol," received a star on the hollywood walk of fame on monday surrounded by some of the real-life stars he has helped to create.

item.title: libyan government dismisses rebels' "mad" truce offer
item.description: muammar gaddafi's government scorned rebel conditions for a nationwide ceasefire, and there was no sign of international diplomatic efforts cooling the libyan conflict.

item.title: mango for dinner and dessert
item.description: now is the time to get acquainted with mangoes. although they're in season from january to august, mangoes peak in may and june.

item.title: coalition "friendly fire" kills 13 libyan rebels
item.description: a nato-led air strike killed 13 libyan rebels, a rebel spokesman said on saturday, but their leaders called for continued raids on muammar gaddafi's forces despite the "regrettable incident."

item.title: the rail: use at own risk: a derby-winning breeder handicaps the derby
item.description: like most veteran horse racing handicappers privileged to inside information, i have been loath to disclose the secrets of my selection process, honed over 20 years of betting on the kentucky derby and that could prove highly valuable to anyone planning to bet this coming saturday.

item.title: new jersey town to limit chicken conjugal visits
item.description: can you feel the love tonight? for roosters in new jersey's hopewell township, it may depend on whether the hook-up falls within the 10 days that would be allowed annually for conjugal visits with hens under a proposed law.

item.title: scientists ask: is the kilo losing weight?
item.description: slight shift in weight for prototypes makes it tougher to set a standard "kilo."

item.title: china dismisses u.s. call on tiananmen anniversary
item.description: china dismissed a u.s. call for it to free dissidents and fully account for the victims of the bloody tiananmen crackdown, on the anniversary of the crushing of the pro-democracy uprising 22 years ago.

item.title: theater review | 'wtc view': after 9/11, changes in a view and in a life
item.description: in 'wtc view,' a manhattan man's roommate search is disrupted by history: the attacks of sept. 11, 2001.

item.title: tiananmen protesters still jailed in china, 22 years on
item.description: twenty-two years after china's bloody crackdown on pro-democracy protests, at least five people remain in jail for joining in the tumult.

item.title: europe: vatican: bishop who broached new rules for priests is ousted
item.description: the vatican ousted an australian bishop, william morris, who had called on the church to consider ordaining women and married men.

item.title: russian regional votes test putin's ruling party
item.description: russians from the bering strait to the baltic voted in regional elections on sunday, testing vladimir putin's ruling party before december parliamentary polls and a presidential vote next march.

item.title: paypal sues google over mobile payment service
item.description: paypal says google stole its ideas for service that turns smartphones into digital wallets.

item.title: libyan rebels make renewed push for oil port brega
item.description: libyan rebels made a renewed effort to push toward the oil port of brega on saturday while muammar gaddafi's forces pounded besieged misrata to the west with rockets and mortars, a rebel spokesman said.

item.title: gaddafi forces attack rebels on ajdabiyah outskirts
item.description: rebels came under fire on the outskirts of ajdabiyah on sunday, hemming them in to their eastern outpost and denting their hopes of pushing west to try to end a stalemate in the libyan war.

item.title: on soccer: a fitting match for the beautiful game
item.description: with fifa choking on its own poison, saturday truly needs a champions league final worthy of its billing.

item.title: allies vow no halt to campaign until gaddafi goes
item.description: the british, french and u.s. leaders vowed on friday to press on with their military campaign in libya until muammar gaddafi leaves power, and rebels said his forces were pounding the besieged city of misrata with missiles.

item.title: north korean defectors learn basics of freedom
item.description: defectors from communist north korea get a crash course in anseong, south korea, on writing resumes, balancing checkbooks and using the inte ...

item.title: obama says libya in stalemate, but "gaddafi will go"
item.description: president barack obama acknowledged on friday there was a "stalemate" on the ground in libya, but said he still expected the three-week-old air campaign to succeed in ousting muammar gaddafi eventually.

item.title: rajaratnam trial jury focuses on more phone taps
item.description: for the second day running, jurors at hedge fund manager raj rajaratnam's insider trading trial asked to listen to replays of some of the secretly-recorded phone conversations at the heart of the government's case.

item.title: mobile wallets coming soon to u.s.? keep waiting
item.description: u.s. shoppers awaiting the day they can wave their cellphones at the check-out counter to buy everything from books to shoes should hang onto their wallets a while longer.

item.title: libyan forces pound misrata, 1,000 evacuated by sea
item.description: a chartered ship evacuated nearly 1,000 foreign workers and wounded libyans from misrata on monday as rebels said they had gained ground in fighting with government forces in the besieged city.

item.title: girl falls to death from new jersey ferris wheel
item.description: an 11-year-old girl on a school trip to the popular shore resort at wildwood, new jersey plunged to her death on friday as she was riding on an amusement park ferris wheel.

item.title: russia kaspersky lab says founder's son freed
item.description: russian law enforcement agencies freed the 20-year old son of kasperky lab's founder eugene kaspersky following a kidnapping last week, the leading anti-virus software firm said in a statement on sunday.

item.title: u.n. says 20 children killed in misrata
item.description: the united nations appealed on tuesday for a ceasefire in the libyan city of misrata, saying at least 20 children had been killed in attacks by besieging government forces on rebel-held parts of the city.

item.title: with sheen, twitter valuation grows
item.description: as speculation grows about possible deals and offerings, is this the micro-blogging site's "lazy sunday" moment?

item.title: renault?s sensational case of stolen secrets is dissolving for lack of proof
item.description: renault, the french automaker, may drop charges against three former employees suspected of selling information because of doubts about evidence in the case.

item.title: france says nato must do more in libya
item.description: libyan rebels reported heavy fighting in the besieged city of misrata on tuesday and france said nato must step up bombing to stop muammar gaddafi's forces attacking civilians.

item.title: western, arab nations say gaddafi must go
item.description: a group of western powers and middle eastern states called for the first time on wednesday for muammar gaddafi to step aside, but nato countries squabbled publicly over stepping up air strikes to help topple him.

item.title: history in high gear at indy 500
item.description: rain has dampened some of the festivities for sunday's 100th anniversary indianapolis 500, but not enough to wipe out this weekend's celebration ...

item.title: midwest: illinois: blagojevich denies a deal
item.description: former gov. rod r. blagojevich told jurors tuesday that he was not interested in taking campaign donations in exchange for president obama's vacated united states senate seat.

item.title: gaddafi "accepts peace roadmap": south africa's zuma
item.description: muammar gaddafi has accepted a roadmap for ending the civil war in libya, south african president jacob zuma said after leading a delegation of african leaders at talks in tripoli.

item.title: libyan fighting goes on after peace bid fails
item.description: an african union plan to halt libya's civil war collapsed, and rebels said the increasingly bloody siege of the city of misrata by muammar gaddafi's troops made talk of a ceasefire meaningless.

item.title: clark kellogg's ohio state challenge
item.description: ex-players turned analysts on college hoops used to be college stars themselves. meaning, they have alma maters and face questions about whether ...
